name: Vegan Lentil Soup
description: This vegan lentil soup is super easy to make, it's so comforting, and packed with nutrients! It's such an easy everyday recipe that is ready in just a little over 30 minutes. The perfect dinner for a cold day!

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the onion. Peel the potatoes and the carrots and cut them into cubes.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the onion. Peel the potatoes and the carrots and cut them into cubes.

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the leek into rings and discard the root end. Place into a colander and rinse well. Rinse the lentils with cold water as well.
recipeInstructions.name: Thinly slice the leek into rings and discard the root end. Place into a colander and rinse well. Rinse the lentils with cold water as well.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the lentils, the carrots, the leek, and the onion into a large pot and add the vegetable broth. Bring to a boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the lentils, the carrots, the leek, and the onion into a large pot and add the vegetable broth. Bring to a boil.

recipeInstructions.text: After 15 minutes of cooking time, add the potatoes and cook for another 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: After 15 minutes of cooking time, add the potatoes and cook for another 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: You could either just season the lentil soup with salt and pepper or add some kind of an easy roux to make it a bit thicker. If you decide to add the roux, melt one tablespoon of vegan margarine in a small pot. Then add a tablespoon of all-purpose flour and a pinch of nutmeg and stir well with a whisk. Cook for about one minute on medium heat. Add it to the lentil soup.
